description: Titled “Flow States,” this Triennial presents a more fluidly plural and multilayered notion of Latinx identity across geographies and cultures.
title: El Museo del Barrio’s 2024 Triennial Expands Latinx Identity to Embrace a Global Perspective

description: With "Exonaut Horizon," the French artist transports us into other temporal and spatial realms, straddling past and future civilizations to celebrate the potential for new life.
title: Jean-Marie Appriou’s Perrotin Show Celebrates the Perpetual Promise of Life in the Cosmos

description: "I would never write a piece of music using A.I. to help me because I want it to be my piece," said the Oscar-winning composer.
title: Hans Zimmer Doesn’t Want to Hear About A.I. Music

description: “The shorter the label, the more people will read it,” asserts museum consultant Judy Rand.
title: Who Decides What Makes a Museum Label Good?

description: Deborah Colker’s production has a deft and beautiful visual poetry, pouring moving bodies and striking vignettes into the spaces around the libretto.
title: True Events Become History and History Becomes Art in the Met’s ‘Ainadamar’

description: From Dijon to Lyon, these vineyards, restaurants and scenic routes showcase the essence of French wine country.
title: A Gourmand’s Guide to Exploring Burgundy and Beaujolais

description: From a splurge-worthy designer product and a classic wet brush to a glamorous gold style and gentle detangling brushes, these are the best travel hairbrushes we're loving and coveting right now.
title: Jet Set: The Best Hairbrushes for Travel
